text: Nina G. Garsoïan (April 11, 1923 – August 14, 2022) was a French-born American historian. Her works focused on Armenian and Byzantine history. In 1969 she became the first female historian to get tenure at Columbia University. From 1977 to 1979, she was dean of the Graduate School of Princeton University. She was born in Paris, France. Garsoïan died on August 14, 2022 in New York City at the age of 99. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:French historians Category:French academics Category:Columbia University faculty Category:American historians Category:Writers from Paris Category:Princeton University faculty
title: Nina Garsoïan
